intro: Lobelia ottoniana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and vibrant blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds, contributing to ecological diversity. Lobelia ottoniana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
